content.description: A "rad and visonary line". Start on the obvious shelf and trend out on bad holds to a crack system on the face.
content.location: Located in the Campus Punks area. The low roof to the left of Freed's Fall.

content.description: Pretty tall but really fun.  Bulbous slopey face with a pleathora of slopey juggy holds.  Kind of a tough topout
content.location: Around the corner from campus punks.  To the right of Gritstone arete.

content.description: A.k.a Perfect Circle   Moderate arete climbing up nice rock. After the first 6ft, all the holds are jugs. That said, the stand-start goes at v0
content.location: Down through the Campus Punks corridor, start sitting on the left arête using the perfectly circular hueco.

content.description: The face climb a few feet left of "Gritstone Arete." Very fun on iron jugs.
content.location: In the corridor between campus punks boulder and gristone boulder, to the left of "Griststone Arete"

content.description: Awesome arete with a moderately heady topout. The crux is near the top. The rock quality is EXCELLENT!
content.protection: A couple of pads are nice. A spotter to keep you off of the awkward block is nice too.
content.location: As you enter the Campus Punks corridor from the front areas, this is the striking arete on your right. Start on the low break and make your way up the arete. Keep a cool head and top out.

content.description: Climb a flake up to a small roof and a nice hand/fist crack.
content.location: Around the corner from campus punks.

content.description: Highball problem that climbs tall face of corridor opposite of Campus Punks and left of Gritstone Arete.  Climb crack/flake and continue up to smaller seams.  Don't blow it at the top.
content.location: Starts at vertical crack in middle of tall wall.

content.description: Climb face to the left of Gritstone Arete, using the arete for right hands. Move through the horizontal breaks, slopers, and a crimpy sidepull to make your way to a heady top out. Listed in the guidebook as 1-star but we thought it was aesthetic and not overly contrived.
content.location: Face immediately left of Gritstone arete, and right of obvious warm up V0 on the corridor wall.

content.description: Nice, relatively easy slab. The crux is down low.
content.location: This route is near the middle of the slabby wall in the Campus Punks area. It follows iron rails to the top.

content.description: Start on jugs below the roof then throw your feet in a high dihedral split to gain some slopers in the crack. Control the swing and throw a solid heal-toe cam up high. Take a deep breath and squeeze your way up between the cheeks jamming anything that fits. A small frame is required to fit through the tight space. Don't forget to look for polyps.
content.protection: One pad and a spotter for the inversion is sufficient.
content.location: On the back side of the paint can boulder

content.description: Begin with left in pocket, then go up the difficult slab face. Left arête is off.
Sit start for Beauty Face on a left undercling and a right crimp. Make some hard moves and finish up Beauty Face. An excellent sit start to an excellent problem.
content.location: Obvious small chalked holds low on Beauty Face.

content.description: Very aesthetic route, only a bit short.    Small fingers will help on this one. A few crimpy moves leads to an easy topout and short scramble to the top.
content.location: Start a few feet right of Paint Can on the left-facing sidepull/crack feature.

content.description: The Campus Punks area is a corridor with great climbs on both sides. One side has slab climbs and the other has face climbs.
